title: get_local_file_url() output unsuitable for clone/submodule add
body:
After https://github.com/datalad/datalad/pull/3975 git-annex related functionality is compatible with this function, but not `git submodule add` -- only on windows.

It needs a test for that, and a fix.

Here is what works (and doesn't) with git:

```sh
# this is a file URL that works with git-annex
(base) C:\Users\mih>git clone file://C/Users/mih/AppData/Local/Temp/datalad_temp_testrepo_sjbknqq2 here
Cloning into 'here'...
fatal: '//C/Users/mih/AppData/Local/Temp/datalad_temp_testrepo_sjbknqq2' does not appear to be a git repository
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Please make sure you have the correct access rights
and the repository exists.

# random internet advice
(base) C:\Users\mih>git clone file:////C/Users/mih/AppData/Local/Temp/datalad_temp_testrepo_sjbknqq2 here
Cloning into 'here'...
fatal: '//C/Users/mih/AppData/Local/Temp/datalad_temp_testrepo_sjbknqq2' does not appear to be a git repository
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Please make sure you have the correct access rights
and the repository exists.

# what works
(base) C:\Users\mih>git clone file:///C/Users/mih/AppData/Local/Temp/datalad_temp_testrepo_sjbknqq2 here
Cloning into 'here'...
remote: Enumerating objects: 25, done.
remote: Counting objects: 100% (25/25), done.
remote: Compressing objects: 100% (20/20), done.
remote: Total 25 (delta 5), reused 0 (delta 0)
```

Conclusion for a working file URL:

- git: `file:///C/Windows/Notepad.exe`
- git-annex: `file://C/Windows/Notepad.exe`

I am not able to find an overlapping form that can work with both. Either we parametrize the function with a purpose-indicator (which is fairly doable), and/or @joeyh considers this a bug and makes git-annex works with the git URL form (too). Given that there does not seem to be a real standard for these, I could understand if the situation remains dis-satisfactory, though.
